summary: The bill, the Graduate Opportunity and Affordable Loans Act, modifies federal student loan limits for graduate and professional students. It increases the annual and aggregate limits for unsubsidized Stafford Loans beginning July 1, 2025. It also terminates Federal Direct PLUS Loans for graduate and professional students, effective July 1, 2025, and mandates notification to students. Phase-out provisions are included for students who received loans before the changes. Institutions can limit loan amounts at their discretion.  The bill aims to change how graduate students access and manage federal loans.
